intro: Cochlearia longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled scabious, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Its most distinctive feature is its long, slender style, which is a characteristic feature of the genus Cochlearia. It typically grows in coastal and maritime environments, thriving in sandy or rocky soils.
